abstract.t: The IPV6_USE_MINMTU socket option is used to set the maximum IPv6 packet size to be used on a socket. Many implementations of TCP running over IPv6 neglect to check the IPV6_USE_MINMTU value when performing MSS negotiation and when contructing a TCP segment. This lead to oversized IPv6 packets being sent resulting in unintended Path Maximum Transport Unit Discovery (PMTUD) being performed and to fragmented IPv6 packets being sent.
